As they shuffle out of the elevator Eric turns around to forward so they can run whilst still carrying the books - they head for the fire exit like some crazed four legged animal - they start to make their way down the stairs - a handful of students have stood up to see what the cause o the commotion is. They descend the stairs at dangerous sp suddenly the most ghastly inaudible cry from behind them. FEMALE LIBRARIAN - large, incensed and apparently fearles chasing them screaming.
They're robbing us! They’re robbing us! They drop the antique books which slide out of the bedshe and down the stairs.
Chas’s POV as the boys burst out of the exit and scramble Warren takes off in the opposite direction and Eric stand scanning for the gettaway car.

(seeing them burst out) Oh Shit. Chas reverses the Van out fast and nearly knocks down the screaming Librarian who starts banging on the rear window Chas drives forward and screeches to a halt next to Eric.

Spencer's POV - he sees this, realises it’s all gone badl wrong.  105 Angle on Spencer who reacts by ducking down out of site a he’s being shot at - face to the roof asphalt, breathing heavily in the dirt. He closes his eyes. Black.
...From black the door slides open and Eric jumps in.
Go! Go, go go.
Where’s the books?

Where the fuck is Warren? Chas navigates the horseshoe-shaped driveway in front of library, picking up too much speed as they round the side the building. They swerve to narrowly avoid hitting an oncoming car, as they do so Warren comes careering out of nowhere on foot - Chas hits the breaks just as he is abou run him over. Warren bounces off the front of the van and knocked hard onto his back but gets up quickly and jumps the passenger door. Inside the van Warren is thrown backw as he attempts to shut the passenger door and Chas takes Warren sits down and suddenly vomits all over himself and dashboard.
Oh Jesus!

Just fucking drive. Chas hits the breaks too late as they reach the main stre the van flies out into the traffic, tires screeching as h narrowly avoids hitting a car - two cars behind collide w one another.
Four consecutive shots of the 4 lads in interview setup - none of them speaks but each looks as though they are absorbing the memory of the event - we stay on Warren:
What the hell had we just done?

Eric is freaking out, Warren is covered in puke and Chas driving like a lunatic. Distant sirens. Eric and Warren g in the back of the van and immediately begin changing int different set of clothes and bagging up their old ones.
Slow down man you’re going to kill us all.
Fuck, fuck, fuck - We fucked up so bad.
Where are the books?
(angry) We dropped the fucking books! They were too heavy. How can we not have known that? How can we not have known how heavy they are?
So we got nothing?
Man we fucked this up so bad.

I have something. Warren reaches into his backpack and pulls out the illuminated manuscript from 1425, a set of the two-volume 15th-century masterpiece, Hortus Sanitatis and Audubon's Synopsis of the Birds of North America. ACTOR WARREN (CONT’D) (to Eric) Dude, what’s in your bag? Eric realises he’s still got the hold-all on his back - h takes it off, opens it and pulls out On the Origin of Spe by Means of Natural Selection by Charles Darwin.
Shit.

Spencer dumps his binoculars in a trash bin as he walks across the quad in front of the main hall - some distance away Police cars are arriving outside the library, lights flashing - cops spill out of the cars and up the library steps just as we follow Spencer up steps and into the exa hall, we hear murmurs ‘Someone’s robbed the library’ - he sits down at his desk and takes out his pencil case.  107
From what I had seen, the whole thing had gone to shit.
Chas slams on the breaks and they look around. A low-inco neighbourhood on the wrong side of the tracks.

Get out, get out! We shouldn’t be seen in this van together. I need to get it back by 1:30 and it’s covered in goddam puke. I‘1l come back for you in my car - just sit tight OK. Warren and Eric stand by the side of the road watching Ch drive away - Catch the Wind by Donavan starts to play. Th mood is calm, anticlimactic, surreal. The screen splits i multiple frames and we rotate through the following MONTA of shots:
Spencer sits in his exam.
Chas washes down the car in his mother’s front yard, hold his nose to stop himself gagging from the puke. He swaps licence plates back over and puts the for-sale sign back the van.

Warren and Eric are on the wrong side of town - they sit waiting with the backpacks at their feet. They become awa of a group of thugs paying an interest in them from the p of a nearby house so they start walking. Eventually Chas pulls alongside them in his car - they get in.
BJ is sat in shock - a mug of tea in her hand, she is surrounded by other concerned librarians and police offic
Chas pulls up at a recycling dump where he and Warren dispense of the bags, their clothes, the tazers, gloves,  108

Eric arrives for his afternoon exam sweaty and dishevelle INT. CHAS’ BEDROOM - DAY Chas lies down on his bed and stares at the ceiling - he pulls a GUN from his bedside table and lies with it on hi chest.
Spencer's exam ends and he leaves the hall. We see him walking past the library. The area has been cordoned off police tape and half a dozen cop cars are still parked up
Warren dyes his hair back from blonde to dark - he pauses look at himself in the mirror.
Transy University was today the unlikely scene of an elaborate...

head_text.subj: A TELEVISION PLAYING REAL NEWS ARCHIVE

text: .-+-and meticulously planned robbery. Helen Robarts has more.

The audacious robbery was carried out in broad daylight today when three men forced their way into the Special Collections Museum, home to some of America’s most valuable books. Once inside they tazered and violently restrained a female librarian before making off with what is believed to be antiquities worth millions of dollars... Angle on the four boys who are stood in silence in Warren Den - eyes fixed on the TV. HELEN -— (CONT'D) Police say the group were highly professional and knew exactly what they were looking for...
Highly professional - you hear that?
Shush - Sh! Listen-  109
The four men made off...
Four? How'd they know there was four of us?
Shush! HELEN — «+. a grey Dodge minivan. Police are appealing for anyone who believes they may have information...
They've got nothing! Seriously. If they had something they’d be putting out photo- fits - they don’t even know how many of us were in the van!
They got a pretty damn good description of it.

With false plates. And guess what? That van'’s probably in Indiana by now. They join arms and start to dance a kind of celebratory j even Spencer who is reticent joins in - the relief - a mo of what feels like joyful friendship that might bond them together for all time. They spin around singing, screamin and laughing as Fugazi’s ‘Waiting Room’ fades in. The pic freezes and the sound echoes over: INT. ERIC’S FORD EXLORER - NIGHT

A hand turns off the music. Inside the car Spencer drives Chas and Eric are stoned or asleep in the back and Warren sits reading in the passenger seat. In his hand is the st first edition of Darwin’s Origin of Species.

(reading aloud) -.."not one of our domestic animals can be named which has not in some country drooping ears; and the view which has been suggested that the drooping is due to disuse of the muscles of the ear, from the animals being seldom much alarmed, seems probable”. Far out. D’you understand what this means dude?  110
(from the back - eyes still closed) It means that we have evolved to a point where we are no longer equipped to survive. We are equipped only to consume and die.
Exactly, it’s not just pets - it’s us. we're so used to being spoon fed that our muscles have withered - our brains have withered. We're alive but we’ve forgotten why.
I know what I’m living for.
(half asleep) to munch cock.. They laugh except for Spencer who watches the road. Angle Spencer driving.

In my mind I think I was done with it at this point. We’d fucked up, we didn’t even have the books we promised the Dutch guys. But we did get some of them so the next thing was to get them appraised before they showed up in the system as stolen...
.-+.-This was in the plan and I guess now we had to see it through to the bitter end.
I didnt agree with it. I didn’t even want to go with them to New York but I felt like I had to because if they fucked up again, we would all pay the price.  111
Forget it - I’m not going in. I’m telling you this is a bad fucking idea.
Chas you’re the one who’s worked at an auctioneers - you know more about this shit than any of us.
No way, this is a whole different ball- game. I’m just saying I’m not going in there to incriminate myself on CCTV.
Well Spencer’s the only one who knows about the books so he has to go and if you're not gonna man-up for it Chas then I'll fucking do it.

If you go in there Warren you better have an answer for everything - I’m not kidding. You slip up and we’re all fucked. You stick to the backstory - don’t give any other personal information away, you understand? Anything that doesn’t smell right, grab the books and get the hell out of there. Are you listening?
I handled the Danish dudes, I think I can handle some suits man. Hey, does anyone know how you tie a tie?

Partly REAL CCTV - classical music, a marble-floored foye with tastefully decorated Christmas Tree, a Modigliani, a large uniformed doorman and an attractive receptionist. Spencer and Warren sit fidgeting in silence.

No disguises this time - we went in looking sophisticated, serious. Warren wears a blue suit, overcoat and cravat and Spencer wears a canary yellow sports jacket and beige 70’s dress- shirt complete with ruffle (seriously). Between them is a wheelie bag.
(a half whisper) Just how we planned it eh brother. Here we are - just you and me. (MORE )
Did you ever think you would be sat right here, right now... An officious and attractive young woman in a red suit, MELANIE HALLORAN, approaches them - professional and hard read.
Mr Williams and Mr Stephens? I’m Melanie Halloran, Mr Leckey’s deputy.
(standing up) Good to meet you Miss Halloran, I’m Jesse Stephens he’s Spencer Williams. Spencer shoots Warren a look.
I’m so sorry, Mr Leckey has been drawn away to a public auction. But if you’re happy to proceed I can try to help and then liaise with Thomas upon his return.
The only thing is Melanie, that the man we work for, Mr Beckman, is very particular and specifically requested that we meet with Mr Leckey - is he likely to be back today?
I would hope so but I can’t say for sure - these things can drag on. I'd hate for you to wait and for him not arrive in time. Williams and Stephens exchange a quick look.
(all smiles) Well I guess we should go ahead with you then. MELANIE HALLORAN INTERVIEW SETUP.

They said they worked for a wealthy collector in Boston, that they had travelled to New York specially on his behalf. They made a big thing about how reclusive Mr Beckman was. I just recall that they were very strangely dressed, very strangely. One of them hardly spoke. I asked them...  113
..-what else can you tell me about the provenance of the books?
Well, Mr Beckman inherited the books some years ago and now wishes to realise their value through a private sale. That’s really all the information he gave us.
Absolutely beautiful aren’t they...
The heron.
I'm sorry?
Uh, the heron - a couple of pages in, I think she’s beautiful. Melanie eyes him as if he is an endearing weirdo. From Warren, a flicker of irritation.
They are absolutely exquisite examples. So I will discuss all this with Mr Leckey and then we can be in touch regarding the estimate and steps toward a private sale.
Well, you see, we were kind of hoping to be able to supply Mr Beckman with an estimate today.

I’m afraid I can’t give you that without Mr Lecke’s sign-off and he may wish to view the books personally. Is there a number we can reach you on while you’re in New York? Angle on Spencer. FREEZE PICTURE.
And here's why I’m not cut out for this.

When you say wait for their call - you mean at the hotel?  114 INT. ERIC’S FORD EXLORER - NEW YORK STREET - DAY The boys have regrouped in the car. Eric in the driver's seat, Chas beside him and Warren and Spencer in the back.
No, on my cell. A slow dawning on Spencer.
(animated) On which cell?
(realising what they’ve done) Yeah, we maybe shouldn't have given them your cell number. Chas explodes

Are you out of your fucking tiny minds - this isn’t a game! This is serious shit - I am not going to prison because you guys are fucking incompetent. No, this isn’t happening, you have got to be kidding me! Ring your cell phone number! - ring it now! He thrusts his cellphone at Spencer. ACTOR CHAS (CONT’D) Fucking ring it! OK, I'll ring it for you dipshit. He puts the phone on loud speaker - it goes to voicemail. SPENCER’S VOICEMAIL ‘sup this is Spence. Drop it like it's hot.
(shouting) Does that sound like a fucking art dealer to you?
We can change the message Chas-

Shut up Eric. Shut the fuck up! (threatening) You need to go in there and get whatever piece of paper that has your phone number on it back right fucking now - because I shit you not, that number is going to put us all in jail you fucking little asshole.  115
Just calm down man - there’s nothing...

(losing it) Don’t tell me to calm down - you are sending us all to jail you fucking idiots! Do you understand what I’m saying or are you too fucking stupid? Chas reaches into the footwell between his legs and start pulling clothes and toiletries violently out of his bag a then suddenly produces a gun and turns round pointing it the back - everyone screams. Freeze picture.
The gun. Yeah, no one saw that coming.
Gun?! There was never a gun. I have no memory of Chas ever pulling a gun. I feel like I would definitely remember that.

All I could think was the gun was going to go off like that scene in Pulp Fiction and Warren or Spencer’s brains were going to be all over the back of my car and we would all be going to prison for hundreds of years for a totally different crime.

(screaming) This is my life you’re fucking with. This is not a game you incompetent fucks. You need to go back in there and get that number back - I don’t give a fuck what you think you know - you have killed us - you have fucking shot us all in the head. You stupid stupid cunts. CHAS INTERVIEW SET UP.

I lost it. My frustration with them was my frustration at myself for getting involved with people who were ultimately totally incompetent. I felt like my life was slipping away from me and for them it was some kind of game.
Why did you have a gun with you?  116
Honestly, I didn’t even stop to think it was illegal in New York - cos in Kentucky you can legally carry a gun.
But why did you own one?

Er, protection I guess. Everyone in Kentucky has a gun. INT. ERIC’S FORD EXLORER - DUSK Silence in the car - Eric drives. Spencer reads from one the stolen books and Warren sleeps. The shine has come of Chas gazes out the window. Rain.

No one was going back to get the number - that would have aroused even more suspicion. We drove through the night in silence, not much was said on the way home. I guess everyone was just alone with their thoughts about the future and wondering what we were going do next. The plan was to sit on the books until the dust settled then find a buyer closer to home.
Spencer gets out of the car outside his dorm block. The o three stay in the car. The mood is sombre.
See you guys around I guess. I’ll call by some time next week.
See you man.
Hey, no hard feelings OK Spence?

Nah, it’s cool man. See you around. We are in the car as it starts to pull off - we watch Spe turn and walk in the direction of the dorm block until he out of sight. Teenage Wasteland by The Who fades up and continues to pl over the following series of shots.  117
The same convivial family dinner - Spencer’s parents and brother and sister laugh at something but Spencer is dist not really present.
Eric sits in an economics seminar - something about the dangers of a property bubble and the overvaluation of bun mortgages. Eric is miles away.

Warren’s Grandparents 60th anniversary party. He wears th same blue suit he wore to Christies - he looks around at the elderly people with liver spots and shaky hands - his grand parents exchange a gummy kiss and everyone cheers. INT. CHAS’ HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Chas on his exercise bike, lifting weights whilst watchin the final scene from the Asphalt Jungle - in which the fatally wounded hero returns home to breathe his last bre in a sun-drenched meadow near where he was born - Kentuck INT. WARREN’S DEN - NIGHT Slow push in on a pile of books wrapped in a sleeping bag underneath Warren's bed.
Everything had changed but nothing was different. We had crossed a line and now we had to try to cross back...

Eric is sat alone at the bar. Drunk - behind him a bunch Frat boys cavort loudly - some of whom we recognise. The camera tracks across the bar to find REAL ERIC (dressed identically) sat next to actor Eric - REAL ERIC speaks to camera:

Nothing had changed - the only difference was it was now somehow even more intolerable.  118 The camera tracks back to ACTOR ERIC who turns around and steams violently into the middle of the group of Frat boy arms flailing wildly - soon they get the better of him an is on the floor being pummeled - he looks strangely seren

I was spending less time with the others. Eric got into a bunch of fights and then got arrested for a DUI. EXT. ERIC’S FORD EXLORER - NIGHT We are racing along beside Eric who is driving like a bat of hell with the window down - Bank Robber by the Clash blaring on the stereo - a fat lip, black eye and a weird smile on his face. We hear a police siren wail, he checks rear view mirror and puts his foot down further.
The most fucked up thing was when Eric got caught drunk driving... The camera booms up to reveal Warren clinging to the roof rack - whooping like a lunatic and banging on the roof to faster.
... Warren was hanging off the roof.
The thing I could never understand at the time was why they just let us off with a caution.

A shot of the pointillist process we have seen before - n much more fluid and practiced - the magazine, the cutting the glue, the transfer of pigment to the image which, whi we can’t clearly make out, we can see it has grown in sca and detail.
Top shot as Spencer lies in bed - he sits up wide-eyed wi jolt as if emerging from a nightmare.
Then one night I just woke up in the middle of the night with a sudden dreadful realisation.  119

Spencer is running down the street in a robe, slippers an pajamas. He arrives at the bungalow and begins knocking o Warren’s basement window. He (and we) get a terrible frig as he spins round to find Warren standing behind him with baseball bat.
What the fuck are you doing - you scared the shit out of me.
The e-mails. We’re fucked. We used the same e-mail address.
What are you talking about?

Walter Beckman. We used the same e-mail address to e-mail the library as we used to e-mail Christies. They’1ll find Halloran and they’1l find the phone number. Chas was right - we’re fucked. We see the truth of this settle upon Warren.
And that’s when the paranoia set in. Although don’t they say it’s not paranoia if someone’s really out to get you.
I found it unbearable to tell you the truth.
Eric is putting a piece of scotch tape across the door ja like Redford in The Sting. INT. REAL CHAS INTERVIEW SET UP.

To me it was when and not if. I wasn’t planning to stick around for the shit to hit the fan so I made plans to take a semester off and tried to figure out how I could leave town for a while.  120 INT. CHAS’ BEDROOM - NIGHT Chas is sat at his desk with a gun in his lap - turning t desk lamp on and then off - he sits in darkness looking o at the street. A car slows down as it passes the house, h crouches down.
As the lecturer talks, an agitated Spencer is watching a student across the room.

A new student started on my course. He also moved into the fourth floor dorms. I was convinced he was an undercover cop. The student in question becomes aware of Spencer staring returns a half-smile and an acknowledging nod. Spencer st back grimly.

The crazy thing was, I was right about the undercover cop - I was just wrong about who it was. From the reverse on Spencer we pull focus to an older-loo female student a couple of desks behind - her eyes fixed Spencer.
Warren is leaving the house - he becomes aware of a garde on the opposite side of the street, a bin man, a man ina passing car - all of whom, in his mind, seem to be watchi him. He breaks into a run.
Hard to describe that feeling. When you know you’re on borrowed time, things are suddenly put in perspective....
Spencer sits at the dinner table surrounded by his family they are laughing and eating and chinking glasses - somet being celebrated, Spencer is tipsy and seemingly overcome with love for his family.
.-.-Things seem better than you ever remember them being... because maybe you know it’s all about to disappear.

Tinny elevator music - row upon row of product - endless iterations of the same thing in different packaging. We reveal this to be Warren’s POV. - he is perusing almost deserted supermarket aisles without purpose - he wheels a empty trolly through a technicolor corridor of breakfast cereal.
Dinner’s over, Spencer is leaving.
Sure you're alright to drive Spence? You had a couple.
Honey, stay the night if you need to.
Nah, I got a big day tomorrow. I love you guys - I'll see you soon. He gives his dad an overly long hug and walks out the doo

Warren is placing some objects in his shopping trolley - quintessentially American junk food, cheese wizz, hot pockets, a ‘hungry man’ ready meal proudly advertising it contents ‘a full pound of food’. He opens the frozen meal freezer, pulls out a box of Chicken Alfredo, scans the ingredients - his POV - a litany of e-numbers, xantham gu msg and stabilizers. He looks around before stashing it u his coat. INT. SPENCER’S ACURA LEGEND - NIGHT Snow has begun to fall - Spencer is at the wheel. As he drives we see his POV - the snow lit up by his headlights falling harder now - hard to see too far ahead - reminisc of a year ago. Angle on Spencer driving - suddenly he clo his eyes.  122

Warren pushes his shopping trolley down an empty aisle of supermarket then shoves it and watches it drift away on i own - he turns and walks past the cashiers toward the exi clutching the stolen ready meal under his coat. As he nea the exit he hears:

Excuse me sir. Sir. Stop - stop right there. INT. SPENCER’S ACURA LEGEND - NIGHT Spencer, eyes closed and speeding into the snowy night - hear the revving of the engine - finally his eyes snap op but too late - he smashes violently into the back of a ca waiting at traffic lights.

Warren begins to run. He turns to throw the ready meal at pursuing security guard who bats it away and tackles him as he gets outside the automatic doors of the store. Warr pinned to the snowy ground looks into camera. INT. CHAS’ BEDROOM - NIGHT Eric bursts in on Chas who startles and reaches for the g that he has on the desk, fumbles it and sends it flying across the desk and out of the open window.
Warren’s been arrested and I can’t reach Spencer. We need to get out of here.
Fuck. Fuck. Where are we going to go?
Canada, we should go to Canada. I have a cousin there. Chas is already up and throwing clothes into a rucksack.
You serious? I was thinking more along the lines of a motel.
We could get on a bus tonight.
Go pack your shit then.  123
(suddenly hearing something) Sh! What’s that?
What?

(a terse whisper) There’s someone in the house. They tiptoe out of the room and edge slowly down the stai where they can clearly hear that there’s someone downstai Chas picks up a dumbbell and puts on an American football helmet and Eric grabs a walking stick as they go tentativ from room to room in relative darkness. The sound is coming from the basement, Warren’s den. They edge toward it. As reach the bottom of the stairs they can see the place has been ransacked - or has it? - they turn the corner and co face to face with Warren - they all jump out of their ski
Fuck, you scared the shit out of me.
I heard you'd been arrested.
Yeah, it was a misunderstanding - they let me go.
What do you mean? What did they arrest you for Warren? CHAS INTERVIEW SET UP.

Something wasn’t right. Besides Warren being a fucking idiot. You don’t bust someone for shoplifting then just let them walk free - that didn’t sit right. Same with Spencer, he totals his car and they just let him walk home? It didn’t add up. INT. WARREN’S DEN - NIGHT Warren sits in bed reading The Rum Diary by the light of lava-lamp. We hear what he’s reading in V.O.

“Tell them it’s fear of the sack. Tell them this man is fleeing St Louis because he suspects the sack is coming down on him and it’s full of something ugly...  124 INT. SPENCER'S DORMROOM - NIGHT. Spencer lies in bed staring at the ceiling.
..-and he doesn’t want to be put in with it. He senses it from afar...
Real Spencer looks calmly into the camera, silent.
...this man is not a model youth. He grew up with two toilets and a football... INT. ERIC’S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Eric is propped up in bed attempting to stay awake but sl dropping off.
.--but somewhere along the line he got warped. Now all he wants is Out, Flee...
Eric looks calmly into the camera saying nothing.
.---and he doesn’t give a good shit for St. Louis or his friends or his family or anything else... INT. CHAS’ BEDROOM - NIGHT Chas lies asleep with a gun in his hand resting on his ch
.--he just wants to find some place where he can breathe... INT. WARREN’S DEN - NIGHT Warren is dropping off - his eyes closing slowly...

(drowsily) some place where he can breathe... Is that good enough for you?” Warren falls asleep and as his arm drops to his side and book falls to the floor - we JUMP OUT OF OUR SKIN at the sound of an almighty crash as we smash cut to:  125

The splintering of wood as the front door bursts open followed by torchlight and shouting raking the interior o the house as the FBI flood through doors and windows. The action slows to slo-mo and slower still - sync-sound drops away as Offenbach’s Barcarolle (or the like) swells we see the boys awaken rudely to the reality of what’s happening around them. Eric attempts to climb out his win onto the roof where he is met with spotlights and threats lie down with his hands on his head, Chas reaches for his and finds himself at the top of the stairs facing a screa FBI agent pointing a shotgun at him. Another housemate an his girlfriend awake naked, terrified and bewildered. At Transy campus Spencer's dorm is raided - he sits up in be with a look of mild relief on his face. Warren awakes in basement where beams of white torch light pierce the floorboards. He sits up in bed and listens to the mayhem above - then lies back down. We are high and wide pushing on Warren as he stares calmly up at us until he is finall found - lit up by torchlight and then dragged roughly fro frame. BLACK. We see REAL NEWS ARCHIVE from the arrest.
What is fear? Fear is an emotion designed to protect you from harm. It makes you avoid danger, prevents you making a silly mistake and getting eaten by a bear or some shit.

But like Darwin said - it’s an emotion most of us don’t run into a whole lot - not real fear anyway. The kind a caveman might have had to deal with. So we look for new ways to experience something like it... As per the opening - we are driving through suburban Lexington everything green, genteel and placid. Old men p hedges, a kid bounces soundlessly on a trampoline... the images we saw in the opening montage. REAL SPENCER (CONT’D) ...to feel like we’re really alive.  126

We pull back from the shot we have seen repeatedly as the anonymous hands fill a last remaining white space with a small point of coloured pigment transferred from a piece coloured magazine page. Slowly we pull back and out to re that we are hovering above an artist in prison overalls w is at work on the floor of a prison cell where he has cre a huge pointillist image made up hundreds of thousands of dots of colour on dozens of sheets of A4 paper and slowly image becomes clear to us. It’s a vivid, exceptional and different rendering of John James Audubons Heron - the on Spencer met on the highway. Angle on the artist taking in work - it’s Actor Spencer, older with a long beard and lo hair - a long long way from the kid we first met.
There have been many times when I've wondered how it’s possible that we went through with it. How all the pieces fell into place... Angle Spencer’s POV - the painted face of Warren.
I’ve never said this to Warren but I’m not sure whether the memory I have of the guy I saw in the park that day...

The scene from Spencer's POV of the man with the scarf an pony tail - reverse on Spencer - his POV - suddenly it’s man with the white hair that Warren described - reverse o Spencer again frowning slightly - his POV again and there no one there just Warren waiting by the hot dog stand.
..-is a memory of a guy I saw, or a memory of a guy Warren told me I saw. And I bet if you ask Eric or Chas they’ve probably wondered, as I have, if Warren ever really did go to Amsterdam?
We see Warren hugging Spencer goodbye as we did before - walks off into the airport and the camera cranes up to th upper level - arrivals - where Warren emerges and jumps i taxi.  127
Or if he did go to Amsterdam - did he ever meet any art-dealers? Did they even exist.
Warren enters the cafe where he met the shady dealers - h looks around but this time they’re not there. He sits dow fires up a joint and orders pancakes.
For all I know Warren sent those e-mails to himself.
Yeah, I guess I have at times wondered if any of that was true. Ha!(laughs) But I know Warren, and he will stick to his story until the day he dies.
We see what seems like b-roll from Warren's interview - a lovable, mischievous and unknowable as ever.
And you know what? It doesn’t even matter anyway if there never was a buyer for the books.
I probably would do it again. Not because I don’t feel terrible about what we did to our parents or that poor lady...

text: Gradually growing up - good, wholesome kids, preppy and conservative, we see shots of their REAL high school graduation.
.»..or that I don’t wish I hadn’t spent 7 years of my youth in jail and destroyed my future. (beat)
I didn’t want that future.  128 WE SEE REAL PHOTOS OF THEM TAKEN IN PRISON —- SHOCKING AN
INT. SPENCER'S PARENTS’ HOME —- INTERVIEW SETUP Spencer's real parents are sat together on the sofa - holding hands - as per the beginnng.

What we went through I can best describe as grief. I don’t think the sentencing was fair at all. They were children. Girls mature faster. Boys are still children at that age. What more proof do you need than this?

You'll probably consider this bullshit - it doesn’t matter to me either way. But jail was the best thing that could have happened to me - not cos I needed to be punished, although I did, but because whatever was expected of me on the outside, I was free of all of it in there. Materialism, vanity, ego, all that - there’s no place for it there. I was set free. Quite the paradox huh?

Aprendi hablar Espanol... (Spencer delivers some of the following speech in Spanish) I shared a cell with a black guy. I met people I would never have met in my life and they taught me more than college ever would have. I felt true fear. I laughed a lot and I cried a lot. I had a seven year sabbatical from the world. It was like a second childhood almost.
We were the one percent. One percent white in a black and Latino jail. One percent rich and one percent educated. But in there it didn’t count for shit. (MORE )
I feel like it’s not until you lose everything that maybe you begin to find something. I opened a portal and I walked through it.
